Interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.subscriptions.ISubscriptionsProvider
Inherited members: ShowHide
Deprecated: ShowHide
View: ClientSubclassPackageImplementation
com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.subscriptions

Interface ISubscriptionsProvider

  • public interface ISubscriptionsProvider
    This interface provides a configurable mechanism for retrieving data about subscription content. The interface must be implemented to provide this function if subscriptions are being used in an application. It will need to access appropriate subscriptions catalog data to populate the necessary subscription fields to enable a subscription to be completed and downloads to be automatically initiated. The class implementing ISubscriptionsProvider will be called from a androidx.work.WorkManager based androidx.work.Worker, and may be called when the app is in the background as the result of push messaging. It will only be called when the SDK determines that the device is online. The ISubscriptionsProvider is provided to the engine through the IBackgroundProcessingManager interface, which itself is registered via the Android manifest.
    Since:
    3.16
    • Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      getAssetParamsForSubscription 
      abstract AssetParams getAssetParamsForSubscription(java.lang.String assetId, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> subscriptionAssetData)
      Implement this method to provide details of an asset, given the asset id and other parameters.
      AssetParams getAssetParamsForSubscription(java.lang.String assetId, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> subscriptionAssetData) throws AssetNoLongerAvailableException
      Implement this method to provide details of an asset, given the asset id and other parameters. If the asset details are temporarily not possible to populate then return null and the engine will make the request again after a time interval and when the device is online. Use HLSAssetBuilder to assemble the parameters for an HLS asset, or use HSSAssetBuilder to assemble the parameters for an HSS asset, or use MPDAssetBuilder to assemble the parameters for an MPEG DASH asset, or use FileAssetBuilder to assemble the parameters for an single file asset.
      Parameters:
      assetId - The external asset ID
      subscriptionAssetData - The map of key-value pairs provided
      Returns:
      an AssetParams derived instance, which can be generated using an AssetBuilder
      Throws:
      AssetNoLongerAvailableException - if the required asset is no longer available in the catalog
      processSubscriptionsFeed 
      abstract com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.IFeed processSubscriptionsFeed(com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.IFeed subscriptionFeed, com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.IFeed existingFeed)
      This method is called to process subscriptions feed data that require lookups prior to creating or updating the feed in the engine.
      com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.IFeed processSubscriptionsFeed(com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.IFeed subscriptionFeed, com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.IFeed existingFeed)
      This method is called to process subscriptions feed data that require lookups prior to creating or updating the feed in the engine. This allows clients to set additional properties for new subscriptions. Clients can override server values or set new values for the feed.
      Parameters:
      subscriptionFeed - The new or updated subscription feed, containing changes delivered from the server.
      existingFeed - The existing subscription feed, if one already existed with the same UUID.
      Returns:
      The subscription feed to store.
      willAddAssetToQueue 
      abstract IIdentifier willAddAssetToQueue(IIdentifier asset)
      Indicates that a new asset has been created.
      IIdentifier willAddAssetToQueue(IIdentifier asset)
      Indicates that a new asset has been created. This method will be called as soon as new asset items have been created and prior to being added to the download queue. The provider may further modify the asset object, such as updating the metadata or adding file-unique headers. It is expected that the implementation of this method will call the IAssetManager.update(IAsset) method prior to returning and that any changes made within this method will be made synchronously.
      Parameters:
      asset - The created asset
